item.title: 20 Year Old Port
item.description: Winemaking Notes:Produced from 100% Napa Valley fruit and made in the traditional port style. Our 20-year old Port comes from a blend of several Port wines made with traditional Port varieties- Tinta Cao Tinta Madera Souzao and Touriga Nacional.The wine was bottled after aging in small oak casks for a minimum of 20 years although some are more than twenty five years in barrel. It’s tawny plum color and caramelized aromas come from the long aging process in barrels giving the wine a unique spicy character and sweet oak tones to go along with the cocoa raspberry and milk chocolate bouquet. The lively acidity and berry flavors pair with aged cheeses (especially blue cheese) and charcuterie with other savory foods like roasted meats and game. Red port with rare duck breast or duck confit is delicious also.
item.summary: BEST OF SHOW FORTIFIED WINE, 94 POINTS & PLATINUM - San Diego Int'l Wine & Spirits Competition

item.title: 2003 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: VINEYARD NOTESThis wine comes from Gary & Melody Morisoli’s Vineyard located in the heart of the famed “Rutherford Bench” below Mt. St. John in the Mayacamas range. Gary is a third-generation farmer in a special part of Napa Valley known for well-drained Bale Clay Loam gravelly soils producing fine- grain supple tannins in the wine and where some of the best Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. The vine rows are oriented on a direction that is slightly North-west by South-East with a “V-trellis” that allows optimum filtered light to hit the ripening grape clusters. Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon is grafted to 110R rootstock on this very cobbly and rocky ground. Gary typically uses very limited irrigation during the growing season essentially dry-farming in most years. The vines were planted in 1990 and V. Sattui has been harvesting these grape to make a single-vineyard designate since the first small harvest of 1993.
item.summary: DOUBLE GOLD - Taster's Guild Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2004 Steve Lee Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: "It's very powerful and tannic and needs age, but it's also exceptionally balanced. Showing ripe red and black currant flavors that have been generously oaked..." - Wine Enthusiast (2008)(Limit: 1 per person)
item.summary: 93 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2005 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Grown in the foothills of the Mayacamas mountains in the upper reaches our Henry Ranch estate, our Mt. Veeder Cabernet, with a touch of Petite Verdot, has distinctive blueberry, tobacco and black olive flavors that are ripe and complex. Poor, acidic soils and the mountain environment create a more tightly-wound, focused flavor profile and firm, yet fine-grained tannins.Vineyard Notes:The rugged mountain elevations and complex marine soils of the Mt. Veeder appellation allow the fruit to mature slowly in this Estate property allowing the development of incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time. We have three clones of Cabernet planted to these steep hills grafted to 1103P and 101-14 rootstock selections and spaced at 9 ft. between rows and 4 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley and in most years it is last cabernet harvested for V. Sattui.(Limit: 2 per person)
item.summary: DOUBLE GOLD - California State Fair

item.title: 2006 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: This Rutherford Cabernet is ripe plush and deeply concentrated. “Classic Napa Cabernet” says Winemaker Brooks Painter. Has won 4 GOLD MEDALS.
item.summary: DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.title: 2006 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Located in the rugged Mayacamas Mountains at elevations ranging from 1250-1400 ft., our Mt. Veeder Estate is situated in a unique microclimate offering cooler temperatures during the day with warmer temperatures at night. Planted on ancient marine soils, the fruit in this vineyard develops slowly and steadily until full phenolic ripeness is reached. Often the very last of our vineyards to be harvested; our Mt. Veeder Estate offers small yields of deeply pigmented, intensely flavored fruit which produce wines of complexity, power and elegance that speak to their provenance year after year.(Limit: 1 per person)
item.summary: DOUBLE GOLD - Taster's Guild International

item.title: 2006 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: This wine is beautifully-structured with plenty of weight and well-integrated tannins this wine is one of Winemaker Jason Moravec's favorites from our coveted collection of library offerings. Enjoy this sumptuous selection now or cellar with confidence. We expect good things from this wine in years to come!
item.summary: GOLD - Taster's Guild International

item.title: 2007 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: On the palate there are deep focused flavors of black cherry wild blackberry dark plum and chocolate with hints of minerality followed by a generous mid-palate silky tannins and a long smooth finish. It shows beautiful fruit ripeness seamless texture and well-integrated oak and tannin. True to form it displays the power and elegance that is so characteristic of this vineyard. Enjoy this with rich meat dishes and cheese. Drinking beautifully right now this wine will age for at least 12 years. Vineyard Notes:Since 1994 V. Sattui has been producing stellar Cabernets from the tiny Morisoli Vineyard located in the very heart of Napa Valley's Rutherford Appellation planted in the deep rich soils on the western Napa Valley floor just west of the small town of Rutherford.(Limit: 2 per person)

item.title: 2007 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Vittorio's Vineyard about thirty acres adjacent to the winery on the south side is planted about half to Cabernet Sauvignon. The soils are gravelly loam and marginally fertile which stresses the vines and produces excellent quality grapes. The vineyard enjoys a microclimate that is perfectly suited to Cabernet and the four other varieties (Merlot Petit Verdot Syrah & Zinfandel) planted there. Vines are spaced 2 x 4 which causes the root balls to compete with one another and they are trained to a vertical curtain. The vines are stressed to the point where we take a European farming approach with our workers making three passes through the vineyard towards the latter part of the season to drop (or thin) clusters so that the vines can fully ripen their load.(Limit: 2 per person)

item.title: 2008 Paradiso
item.description: This premium proprietary blend which we have named Paradiso (Pahr-a DEEZ-0h) consists of Cabernet Sauvignon (89%) Merlot (8%) and Petit Verdot (3%). The Cabernet Sauvignon comes from Preston Vineyard one of our top Rutherford Appellation vineyards while the Merlot is from our Henry Ranch and finally the Petit Verdot is from the excellent "Vittorio's Vineyard" adjacent to the winery in St. Helena. The dusty mocha and cassis-filled Rutherford Cabernet combines with cool-climate elegant Carneros Merlot which is then topped off with the inky cedary aromatic Vittorio's Vineyard Petit Verdot. Ripe black cherry fruit hints of coffee and cocoa black currant in the nose - it shows fruit and tannin structure and complexity that portends excellent long-term age worthiness. "We are trying to achieve a clear balance and harmony among the components" says Brooks Painter Director of Winemaking. "The different attributes of each grape engage masterfully with one another to create an extremely enjoyable drinking experience - a real marvel of a wine. After 18 months of bottle age it has developed a very interesting and complex bouquet and depth of flavors that will deliver in the nose and on the palate. We're extremely pleased with the result - Enjoy!"(Limit: 3 per person)
item.summary: BEST AMERICAN BORDEAUX BLEND & PLATINUM MEDAL - Mainly Meritage International Wine Competition

item.title: 2008 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Preston Vineyard is located in the Rutherford Appellation where some of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. This was one of the first cabernet vineyards that Dario Sattui was drawn to in the early years. It is a very small region of Napa known for its gravelly soils which produce rich alluring and opulent red wines with fine-grained tannins and incredible complexity. The alluvial soils from Mount St. John have washed down from the hills over millennia to create a unique layering of weathered rock and gravel mixed with clay. The vines are 40-plus years old 10’ X 8’ spacing and trained to a divided canopy or “Quad”. The trellis allows ample light penetration on the fruit creating perfect flavor development and excellent maturity in the grapes at harvest.(Limit: 2 per person)"...it's exceptionally ripe in blackberry and cherry fruit with a liqueur richness of crème de cassis and it should have no trouble in the cellar." - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2009 Paradiso
item.description: Most of the Cabernet Sauvignon comes from Preston Vineyard one of our top Rutherford Appellation vineyards with the rest of the Cabernet from the new Coombsville AVA and Mt Veeder. The Merlot is from our Henry Ranch estate in Los Carneros and the Petit Verdot is from our estate Vittorio's Vineyard adjacent to the winery in St. Helena. The dusty Rutherford fruit combines beautifully with the other cool-climate Cabernet lots while the Carneros Merlot brings red cherry aromas and supple tannins. A small amount of the cedary aromatic Vittorio's Vineyard Petit Verdot brings a mineral aspect and backbone and intensity to the composition. An altogether elegant blend that is glorious now and will age wonderfully for several years to come.(Limit: 1 per person)

item.title: 2009 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’ and rows are slightly north of east-west and grown to a VSP trellis. These well-drained gravelly soils promote early-ripening and optimum maturity and they are often the first Cabernet grapes of the harvest. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012.(Limit: 2 per person)
item.summary: 94 POINTS - Michael Franz, Wine Review Online

item.description: Vineyard Notes:Tiny Morisoli Vineyard sits at the foot of Mt. St. John on the western edge of the renowned Rutherford Bench from which many of Napa Valley's finest Cabernets are born. The bench land is slightly elevated and considerably flat with gravelly and sandy loam deposited from millennia of ancient creeks meandering through it on the way to the river. The vineyard is almost entirely organic and no herbicides are ever applied.(Limit: 1 per person)

item.description: 125th Anniversary Vintage "The Morisoli Vineyard has long been one of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon vineyards in the Napa Valley and it consistently produces one of the strongest Cabs in the V. Sattui arsenal. This beautiful wine is rich and dense on the palate with a nose of cassis and ripe blackberry and spice. The oak is beautifully judged lending warmth and a hint of spice. This smooth supple gem of a Cab took gold at the Winemaker Challenge International Wine Competition in San Diego recently."

item.title: 2010 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: The hillside location of this vineyard is ideal for Cabernet as it sits above the fog line enjoying warmer days and cooler nights. This lovely Cabernet shows expressive mountain-bred fruit flavors of crushed berry cassis and plum punctuated by bright herbal notes and cedar. Try this with grilled herb-crusted sirloin or filet mignon.

item.title: 2010 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Some of California's most sought-after and expensive wines come out of the Rutherford AVA the historical core of the Napa Valley and from where V. Sattui has been producing Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignons for more than thirty-three years. Cabernet performs marvelously here giving sumptuous wines of great profundity and longevity; and its preeminence here is no new idea. Gustave Niebaum's 19th-century Inglenook made Cabernets in 1887-89 that still survive and Georges de Latour knew in 1900 that his BV Cabernets had world class results as well. Preston Vineyard is but a stone's throw from these great estates.It's thought that the secret to Rutherford Cabernet lies in the gravelly loam soil and the well-drained bench lands at the foot of the Mayacamas Mountains just west of the town of Rutherford. 'Rutherford dust' is the catchword for the particular character imparted by sun and soil here; and it's no mistake that vintage after vintage the compelling trait in our Preston Cabernets is its dusty leathery cigar-box quality that frames the delicious fruit that we always receive from this coveted 28-acre parcel.Vineyard Notes:Preston Vineyard is located in the Rutherford Appellation where some of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. This was one of the first cabernet vineyards that Dario Sattui was drawn to in the early years. It is a very small region of Napa known for its gravelly soils which produce rich alluring and opulent red wines with fine-grained tannins and incredible complexity. The alluvial soils from Mount St. John have washed down from the hills over millennia to create a unique layering of weathered rock and gravel mixed with clay. The vines are 40-plus years old 10’ X 8’ spacing and trained to a divided canopy or “Quad”. The trellis allows ample light penetration on the fruit creating perfect flavor development and excellent maturity in the grapes at harvest.(Limit: 2 per person)

item.title: 2011 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:This vineyard with perhaps the southernmost vines in the Mt. Veeder AVA produces a focused herb-tinged Cabernet with fine tannins and a long elegant finish. The hillside location of this vineyard is ideal for Cabernet as it sits above the fog line enjoying warmer days and cooler nights. item.title: 2011 Paradiso - Double Magnum
item.description: The 2011 Paradiso’s color is dark ruby red very “inky” and opaque. It shows youthful aromas of cassis black cherry and floral hints of violets. The oak is well-integrated; it balances the wine’s natural acidity and provides a bouquet of cocoa black licorice and tobacco notes. Upon entry there is a burst of rich black fruit that is round and supple leading to intense black currant and red berry fruit on the mid-palate. It shows lingering opulent fruit flavors an elegant texture and polished tannins in a long finish.

item.title: 2011 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: The 2011 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon has an opaque deep purple-black color with juicy fresh black cherry black olive and cassis in the nose. The subtle oak bouquet has nice chocolate and cedary aromatics. It is silky on the palate with sweet black fruit flavors that are nicely balanced with a full-bodied rich texture that finishes with soft tannins. Some of California's most sought-after and expensive wines come out of the Rutherford AVA the historical core of the Napa Valley and from where V. Sattui has been producing Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignons for more than thirty-three years. Cabernet performs marvelously here giving sumptuous wines of great profundity and longevity; and its preeminence here is no new idea. Gustave Niebaum's 19th-century Inglenook made Cabernets in 1887-89 that still survive and Georges de Latour knew in 1900 that his BV Cabernets had world class results as well. Preston Vineyard is but a stone's throw from these great estates. It's thought that the secret to Rutherford Cabernet lies in the gravelly loam soil and the well-drained bench lands at the foot of the Mayacamas Mountains just west of the town of Rutherford. "Rutherford dust" is the catchword for the particular character imparted by sun and soil here; and it's no mistake that vintage after vintage the compelling trait in our Preston Cabernets is its dusty leathery cigar-box quality that frames the delicious fruit that we always receive from this coveted 28-acre parcel."Rich and slightly chewy, V. Sattui's 2011 Preston Vineyard Cab is a Cab lover's Cabernet... Though richly extracted, the Preston is well balanced and inviting now even though it will not hit its peak for some time." - Robert Whitley(Limit: 6 per person)
item.summary: BEST CAB, 96 POINTS & PLATINUM - San Diego International Wine Competition

item.title: 2011 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: "Rich and slightly chewy V. Sattui's 2011 Preston Vineyard Cab is a Cab lover's Cabernet. Dense and layered it shows ripe dark fruits supported by firm tannins that will need another two to three years to come around. Those who have the patience to cellar this big bad Napa red should hold it until at least 2018 but 2021 to 2025 would be optimum. Though richly extracted the Preston is well balanced and inviting now even though it will not hit its peak for some time. This wine was awarded a platinum medal at the 2014 Sommelier Challenge wine competition."

item.title: 2011 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: This vintage is 84% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Petit Verdot with a finishing dose of Malbec and Syrah. The Cabernet Petit Verdot and Syrah come from our Vittorio's Vineyard. We have six Cabernet blocks about two acres each with different clones including Clone 6 (also known as the Jackson clone which produces small berries loose clusters and very concentrated fruit). The Malbec comes from our Carsi Vineyard in Yountville and gives additional color and intensity to the blend.Vineyard Notes:Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton Loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’ and rows are slightly north of east-west and grown to a VSP trellis. These well-drained gravelly soils promote early-ripening and optimum maturity and they are often the first Cabernet grapes of the harvest. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012.(Limit: 2 per person)
item.summary: GOLD MEDAL - San Francisco Wine Competition

item.title: 2011 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum

The winery has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as Organically- Farmed by the CCOF in 2012.

item.title: 2012 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:This wine comes from Gary & Melody Morisoli’s Vineyard located in the heart of the famed “Rutherford Bench”. Gary is a third-generation farmer on this property a special part of Napa Valley known for well-drained gravelly soils which produce fine-grain supple tannins in the wine and where some of the best Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. The vine rows are oriented on a direction that is slightly North-west by South-East with a “V-trellis” that allows optimum filtered light to hit the ripening grape clusters. Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon is grafted to 110R rootstock on this very cobbly and rocky ground. Gary typically uses very limited irrigation during the growing season essentially dry-farming in most years. The vines were planted in 1990 and V. Sattui has been harvesting these grape to make a single-vineyard designate since the first small harvest of 1993.(Limit: 6 per person)
item.summary: 96 POINTS - Rich Cook, Wine Review Online

item.title: 2012 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: "Winemaker Brooks Painter and his crew always bring out all that Morisoli has to offer and in this vintage it's lively raspberry fruit joined perfectly by pie spice mild dried herbs cedar and cigar. It's got a big structured backbone that begs further aging while providing great delight at present. Decant or go long? You win either way."
item.summary: 96 POINTS - Rich Cook, Wine Review Online

item.title: 2012 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Deep aromas of blackberry cassis bay leaf and brown spice prepare you for a mouth filling structured glass that shows supple mountain tannins serving to translate the aromas directly to palate flavors. This wine is fabulous right now and will bring even greater rewards 10 years down the road.Vineyard Notes:The rugged mountain elevations and complex marine soils of the Mt. Veeder appellation allow the fruit to mature slowly in this Estate property allowing the development of incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time. We have three clones of Cabernet planted to these steep hills grafted to 1103P and 101-14 rootstock selections and spaced at 9 ft. between rows and 4 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley and in most years it is last cabernet harvested for V. Sattui.(Limit: 2 per person)
item.summary: WINE OF THE YEAR, 98 POINTS & BEST CABERNET - Monterey Wine Competition

item.title: 2012 Preston Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: From one of our flagship vineyard sources this Rutherford Cabernet is both powerful and complex."The juggernaut that is V. Sattui Winery continues to roll out spectacular Cabernet Sauvignon from this vineyard. The nose is extremely deep and complex with solid varietal character firm tannic structure lively acidity and a long finish that is currently emphasizing elegant red fruit and spice. This deserves five to ten years additional bottle aging to bring out all of its charms though they are already many. A Platinum Award winner and Best of Class Cabernet Sauvignon at the 2015 Sommelier Challenge International Wine Competition."95 points Rich Cook Sep 15 2015
item.summary: BEST OF CLASS, 95 POINTS & Platinum - Sommelier Challenge

item.title: 2012 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: Vittorio's Vineyard is named after Dario Sattui's great-grandfather Vittorio who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco's North Beach neighboerhood in 1885. The winery has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as Organically- Farmed by the CCOF in 2012.

item.title: 2013 Black-sears Vineyard Zinfandel - Magnum
item.description: This wine has impressive structure with firm gripping tannins and excellent acidity; benefits of Napa County's highest vineyard which is also biodynamically farmed and certified organic. What's best about this wine is the impeccable balance it shows off. This is a Zinfandel made in a style that is both restrained and loaded with flavor. The V. Sattui Black Sears Zinfandel is delicious today however those with patience will be rewarded. This wine is an ager to be sure. It'll improve over the next 5-8 years and drink well for at least 4-6 after that.Vineyard Notes:Black-Sears Vineyard is located in the Howell Mountain sub-appellation of Napa Valley. It was planted in 1975 and, at an elevation of 2400 ft., one of the highest vineyards in Napa County. Soils are rocky and porous which allows for good drainage. Black-Sears vineyard blooms later in the season due to the cooler climates on the mountain and so harvest is generally later in the fall. The original vine cuttings came from the old Hayne Vineyard in St. Helena, one of the “Heritage Clones” of Zinfandel. The vines are head trained and the grapes are cultivated organically and bio-dynamically, requiring extra care and attention to bring to full maturity. The vines are head trained they look like a big goblet.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.

item.summary: BEST OF CLASS & 94 POINTS - Critics Challenge

item.title: 2013 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Carsi Vineyard lies about thirteen miles south of the winery in a wide flat basin just north of the town of Napa. It's a cooler zone of heavier soils where Chardonnay does exceptionally well. V. Sattui purchased the land in 1989 and invested heavily in soil amendments fertilization and trellising of the existing vines before naming it after my great-grandfather Vittorio's Italian village in the mountains above Genoa. We began to produce some excellent Chardonnays in just a short time.Winemaking Notes: Grapes are picked at night and delivered to the winery in half ton macro bins. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is settled for 24 hours at 50ºF, and then racked off the grape solids. Specialty Chardonnay fermenting yeast is added to the must, and then it is transferred to barrels where it will start barrel fermentation. Native fermentations will go to barrels without any yeast. Once alcoholic fermentation is completed winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation. All lots will be stirred biweekly through malolactic, and will stay on its lees until racked out for blending and bottling. 1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 91 POINTS - Wine Spectator

item.title: 2013 Los Carneros Chardonnay - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Huichica Creek Vineyard (59%) is located in Los Carneros, Napa Valley AVA, close to the San Francisco Bay and it has VSP trellis with three clones of Chardonnay: UCD Clone 5, Dijon Clone 95 and the “Old Wente” Clone, all on 101-14 rootstock. The Henry Ranch (41%) is also located in Los Carneros, Napa Valley AVA, but it at a higher elevation and farther away from the bay, along Carneros Creek and adjacent to the Mt Veeder AVA. It is planted to the Dijon selections 96 and 76 on 5C rootstock on a VSP trellis system, and the “Old Wente” clone on 101-14 rootstock on a modified “High V” trellis. The Dijon clones tend to be earlier ripening, with softer acidity while the UCD clone 5 has a bright acidity which provides good acid balance to the blend. The “Old Wente” clone has a distinct cluster shape and size, with smaller berries that are irregular in size and it is a lower yielding clone favored by winemakers for its intensity of aroma and flavor.Winemaking Notes:Grapes are picked at night and delivered to the winery in half ton macro bins. They are loaded in the press whole cluster. The juice is settled for 24 hours at 50ºF then racked. Specialty Chardonnay fermenting yeast is added to the tank then transferred to barrels where it will be fermented. Native, “indigenous yeast” fermentations (15-30% of total) are transferred to barrels without any added yeast. Once the primary alcoholic fermentation is completed winemaking will determine which lots will go through a secondary, malolactic fermentation. All lots are stirred biweekly in a process known as "battonage" to re-suspend the yeast. All lots will stay on its lees "sur-lie" until lots are racked out for blending and bottling. 1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 91 POINTS - Wine Spectator

item.title: 2013 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: The rugged mountain elevations and complex marine soils of the Mt. Veeder appellation allow the fruit to mature slowly in this Estate property allowing the development of incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time. We have three clones of Cabernet planted to these steep hills grafted to 1103P and 101-14 rootstock selections and spaced at 9 ft. between rows and 4 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley and in most years it is last cabernet harvested for V. Sattui.One of our darkest cabernets with incredibly inky color it has ripe aromas of plum cherry fruit black olive and dried savory herbs in the nose. It is soft and very elegant on the palate with a round supple texture. Cassis and black cherry fruit flavors linger on the finish.(Limit: 2 per person)

item.title: 2013 Paradiso - Double Magnum
item.description: Paradiso is our red “Meritage” a Bordeaux-style wine that is a blend of 73% Cabernet Sauvignon 21% Merlot 3% Malbec and 3% Petite Verdot. The 2013 Paradiso’s color is dark ruby red very “inky” and opaque. It shows youthful aromas of cassis black cherry and floral hints of violets. The oak is well-integrated; it balances the wine’s natural acidity and provides a bouquet of cocoa black licorice and tobacco notes. It shows lingering opulent fruit flavors an elegant texture and polished tannins in a long finish.
item.summary: 96 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2013 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Preston Vineyard is located in the Rutherford Appellation where some of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. This was one of the first cabernet vineyards that Dario Sattui was drawn to in the early years. It is a very small region of Napa known for its gravelly soils which produce rich alluring and opulent red wines with fine-grained tannins and incredible complexity. The alluvial soils from Mount St. John have washed down from the hills over millennia to create a unique layering of weathered rock and gravel mixed with clay. The vines are 40-plus years old 10’ X 8’ spacing and trained to a divided canopy or “Quad”. The trellis allows ample light penetration on the fruit creating perfect flavor development and excellent maturity in the grapes at harvest.
item.summary: 97 POINTS & PLATINUM - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2013 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: 94% Cabernet Sauvignon 4% Merlot 2% Petit Verdot Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton Loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’ and rows are slightly north of east-west and grown to a VSP trellis. These well-drained gravelly soils promote early-ripening and optimum maturity and they are often the first Cabernet grapes of the harvest. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012. 2013 was an unusually dry year. Spring only brought less than 5” of rain and the warm days set the stage for an ideal flowering and fruit set conditions. Temperatures were optimal for vine activity resulting in healthy vines as fruit went through veraison and grapes started maturing. August 1st was the start of harvest earliest recorded in recent history. White varietals came first followed by lighter reds. The warm temperatures throughout October allowed the later maturing varietals to hang and come to perfect phenolic ripeness. 2013 vintage was early and came in full rage two weeks early but the quality it delivered was exceptional.

item.title: 2014 Anderson Valley Pinot Noir - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: The Anderson Valley is located in the rolling hills of the coastal region of Mendocino County about two hours north of San Francisco. Only fifteen miles long half the length of Napa Valley this beautiful valley is home to a unique group of vineyards that produce a broad range of excellent wines including Burgundian varietals like Pinot Noir. The climate is significantly influenced by its proximity to the Pacific Ocean and is one of the coolest AVAs in the state as well as getting about 40 inches of rain each year also more than most wine regions.Boonville is our ranch in the Anderson Valley appellation it has the name of the town itself. There are 11.6 acres divided into 5 small blocks each planted with different Pinot Noir clone or filed selection. Clone 115, 667 and 777 dark pigments and rich structure, and pure aromas, and the Calera selection comes from cuttings from a true Burgundian clone from Josh Jenson’s Mt Harlan Vineyard, as well as another selection from DRC which offer more seductive complexities.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.

item.title: 2014 Regina
item.description: Winemaking Notes:These grapes are picked late in the fall season at night in ½ ton bins arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled the clear juice is then racked into 100% new French Oak barrels where they are inoculated with yeast strain SL3. This is a special yeast strain ideal for fermentations with varietals that are exceptionally aromatic to preserve these fruit forward characteristics. When fermentation is complete a significant amount natural sugar is still present in the wine but over its two-year aging process begins transform its flavor and intensity.

The climate is significantly influenced by its proximity to the Pacific Ocean and is one of the coolest AVAs in the state as well as getting about 40 inches of rain each year also more than most wine regions.Boonville is our ranch in the Anderson Valley appellation it has the name of the town itself. There are 11.6 acres divided into 5 small blocks each planted with different Pinot Noir clone or filed selection. Clone 115, 667 and 777 dark pigments and rich structure, and pure aromas, and the Calera selection comes from cuttings from a true Burgundian clone form Josh Jenson’s Mt Harlan Vineyard, as well as another selection from DRC which offer more seductive complexities.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Critics' Challenge International Wine Competition

item.title: 2015 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Carsi Vineyard lies about thirteen miles south of the winery in a wide flat basin just north of the town of Napa. It's a cooler zone of heavier sols where Chardonnay does exceptionally well. V. Sattui purchased the land in 1989 and invested heavily in soil amendments fertilization and trellising of the existing vines before naming it after my great-grandfather Vittorio's Italian village in the mountains above Genoa. We began to produce some excellent Chardonnays in just a short time.Winemaking Notes: Grapes are picked at night and delivered to the winery in half ton macro bins. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is settled for 24 hours at 50ºF, and then racked off the grape solids. Specialty Chardonnay fermenting yeast is added to the must, and then it is transferred to barrels where it will start barrel fermentation. Native fermentations will go to barrels without any yeast. Once alcoholic fermentation is completed winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation. All lots will be stirred biweekly through malolactic, and will stay on its lees until racked out for blending and bottling. 1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 90 POINTS & GOLD - Monterey Wine Competition

item.title: 2015 Los Carneros Chardonnay - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: The grapes come from our own historic Hibbard Ranch property in Los Carneros as well as renowned Chardonnay source Huichica also in Los Carneros.Winemaking Notes: Grapes are picked at night and delivered to the winery in half ton macro bins. They are loaded in the press whole cluster. The juice is settled for 24 hours at 50ºF then racked. Specialty Chardonnay fermenting yeast is added to the tank then transferred to barrels where it will be fermented. Native fermentations will be transferred to barrels without any yeast. Once alcoholic fermentation is completed winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation. All lots will be stirred biweekly. All wine will stay on its lees until lots are racked out for blending and bottling. 1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: BEST OF CLASS - San Francisco Chronicle Wine Competition

item.title: 2015 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:This wine comes from Gary & Melody Morisoli’s Vineyard located in the heart of the famed “Rutherford Bench”. Gary is a third-generation farmer on this property a special part of Napa Valley known for well-drained gravelly soils which produce fine-grain supple tannins in the wine and where some of the best Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. The vine rows are oriented on a direction that is slightly North-West by South-East with a “V-trellis” that allows optimum filtered light to hit the ripening grape clusters. Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon is grafted to 110R rootstock on this very cobbly and rocky ground. Gary typically uses very limited irrigation during the growing season essentially dry-farming in most years. The vines were planted in 1990 and V. Sattui has been harvesting these grapes to make a single-vineyard designate since the first small harvest of 1993. "This red is pointed in the right direction with a mix of supple spicy dark berry currant plum and cedary oak flavors. Very complete. Best from 2020 through 2030." - W.S.(Limit: 6 per person)
item.summary: WINE OF THE YEAR, BEST CABERNET & 97 POINTS - Monterey Wine Competition

item.title: 2015 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon - Double Magnum
item.description: The rugged mountain elevations and complex marine soils of the Mt. Veeder appellation allows the fruit to mature slowly in the Estate property developing incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time. We have three clones of Cabernet planted to these steep hills grafted to 1103P and 101-14 rootstock selections and spaced at 9 ft. between rows and 4 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley and in most years it is last cabernet harvested for V. Sattui.

item.title: 2015 Preston Cabernet Sauvignon - Magnum
item.description: The Preston Vineyard is located in the Rutherford Appellation where some of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. This was one of the first cabernet vineyards that Dario Sattui was drawn to in the early years. It is a very small region of Napa known for its gravelly soils which produce rich alluring and opulent red wines with fine-grained tannins and incredible complexity. The alluvial soils from Mount St. John have washed down from the hills over millennia to create a unique layering of weathered rock and gravel mixed with clay. The vines are 40-plus years old 10’ X 8’ spacing and trained to a divided canopy or “Quad”. The trellis allows ample light penetration on the fruit creating perfect flavor development and excellent maturity in the grapes at harvest.
item.summary: 94 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2015 Vintage Port
item.description: Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where peak temperature is typically 92ºF and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee.Before all the sugar has been converted to alcohol, a neutral grape brandy is added to the wine; this process is known as fortification. The addition of brandy to the wine halts fermentation by inhibiting the yeast from converting sugar to alcohol. The resulting wine retains some of its residual sugar with an alcohol that is typically around 18% alcohol by volume (abv). The wine is then racked from stainless steel tank to seasoned French oak barrels where they will age and be topped bi-annually.

item.title: 2015 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: "A testament to what happens when great fruit and great winemaking practice come together. Brooks Painter’s team seems to never miss with this vineyard with this vintage showing a complex mix of red and black fruit fall spice pleasantly chalky tannins and bright acidity that gives the finish a big push. Elegant and refined. A Platinum Award Winner at the 2018 Critics Challenge International Wine & Spirits Competition." -96 Points Rich Cook May 26th 2018 Vineyard Notes:Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton Loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’ and rows are slightly north of east-west and grown to a VSP trellis. These well-drained gravelly soils promote early-ripening and optimum maturity and they are often the first Cabernet grapes of the harvest. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012.(Limit: 1 per person)
item.summary: 96 POINTS & PLATINUM - Critics Challenge International Wine Competition

item.title: 2016 Anderson Valley Pinot Noir - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: The Anderson Valley is located in the rolling hills of the coastal region of Mendocino County about two hours north of San Francisco. Only fifteen miles long half the length of Napa Valley this beautiful valley is home to a unique group of vineyards that produce a broad range of excellent wines including Burgundian varietals like Pinot Noir. The climate is significantly influenced by its proximity to the Pacific Ocean and is one of the coolest AVAs in the state as well as getting about 40 inches of rain each year also more than most wine regions.We source grapes for our Anderson Valley Pinot Noir from our very own estate ranch in Boonville. We have 11.6 acres divided into 5 small blocks, each of which are planted with different Pinot Noir clones or field selection. Clone 115, 667 and 777 dark pigments and rich structure, and pure aromas, and the Calera selection comes from cuttings from a true Burgundian clone form Josh Jenson’s Mt Harlan Vineyard, as well as another selection from DRC which offer more seductive complexities.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is RC212. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: BEST PINOT NOIR, 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Sommelier Challenge

item.title: 2016 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Carsi Vineyard lies about thirteen miles south of the winery in a wide flat basin just north of the town of Napa. It's a cooler zone of heavier soils where Chardonnay does exceptionally well. V. Sattui purchased the land in 1989 and invested heavily in soil amendments fertilization and trellising of the existing vines before naming it after my great-grandfather Vittorio's Italian village in the mountains above Genoa. We began to produce some excellent Chardonnays in just a short time. Winemaking Notes: The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into 100% new French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay from this vineyard into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouthfeel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic, and will age on its lees for ten months until racked out for blending and bottling.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 91 POINTS - California Grapevine

item.title: 2016 Los Carneros Chardonnay - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our Los Carneros Chardonnay is an exquisite compilation of select vineyards throughout the AVA, each site bringing a certain nuance to the finalized blend. The cool climate in Carneros makes it ideal for growing Chardonnay grapes, and this wine is here to prove it. The grapes come from our own historic Hibbard Ranch property, as well as renowned Chardonnay source, Huichica Vineyard, also in Los Carneros.Winemaking Notes: The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into 100% new French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay from this vineyard into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouthfeel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic, and will age on its lees for nine months until racked out for blending and bottling.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: BEST CHARDONNAY, 94 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.title: 2016 Los Carneros Pinot Noir - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2016 Los Carneros Pinot Noir is a glorious representation of this world renowned viticultural area. The fruit for this wine comes from our estate vineyard, Henry Ranch, located along Carneros Creek and adjacent to the Mt. Veeder AVA. It is planted to four different clones, Dijon selections 115 and 777, clone 828 and Pommard clone 5, all grafted to 44-53 rootstocks on a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system. The VSP trellis forces clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions. Summer average temperatures range from 50 to 90 F which makes it ideal site for these varietals. Cool summer nights retain the acidity and hot days bring the maturity to perfection.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is RC212. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 94 POINTS & PLATINUM - Critic's Challenge International Wine Competition

Gary is a third-generation farmer on this property a special part of Napa Valley known for well-drained gravelly soils which produce fine-grain supple tannins in the wine and where some of the best Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. The vine rows are oriented on a direction that is slightly North-West by South-East with a “V-trellis” that allows optimum filtered light to hit the ripening grape clusters. Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon is grafted to 110R rootstock on this very cobbly and rocky ground. Gary typically uses very limited irrigation during the growing season essentially dry-farming in most years. The vines were planted in 1990 and V. Sattui has been harvesting these grapes to make a single-vineyard designate since the first small harvest of 1993.(Limit: 2 per person)

item.title: 2016 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: This expressive mountain gem weaves a seamless story of flavors and aromas that will continue to develop new chapters for years to come. Cellar with confidence or pair now with slow-braised beef short ribs on a bed of polenta or creamy mashed potatoes for a memorable meal.Vineyard Notes:Located in the rugged Mayacamas Mountains at elevations ranging from 1250-1400 ft. our Mt. Veeder Estate is situated in a unique microclimate offering cooler temperatures during the day with warmer temperatures at night. Planted on ancient marine soils the fruit in this vineyard develops slowly and steadily until full phenolic ripeness is reached. Often the very last of our vineyards to be harvested; our Mt. Veeder Estate offers small yields of deeply pigmented intensely flavored fruit which produce wines of complexity power and elegance that speak to their provenance year after year.(Limit: 3 per person)
item.summary: WINE OF THE YEAR, 98 POINTS & PLATINUM - San Diego International Wine & Spirits Challenge

item.title: 2016 Paradiso
item.description: Paradiso is the proprietary name for our red “Meritage” a Bordeaux-style blended wine that changes in varietal composition from vintage to vintage. The 2016 vintage Paradiso consists of: 64% Cabernet Sauvignon 20% Merlot 12% Malbec 2% Petite Verdot 2% Cabernet Franc(Limit: 2 per person)
item.summary: 98 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.title: 2016 Paradiso - Double Magnum
item.description: This beautiful Bordeaux blend uses all five of the classic Bordeaux grape varieties bringing the flavors and characters of the individual grapes into a fabulous expression of cellar-worthy Cabernet Sauvignon wine. It is loaded with black cherry aromas black pepper spice and rich blackcurrant and jammy notes and tannin structure from the Cabernet. The red berry fruit and round ripe plum and cocoa from the Merlot are joined with the assertive earthy tones of Malbec minerals and graphite/pencil lead and cedar from Petite Verdot and savory aromatic herbs and hazelnut from the Cabernet Franc. Together they make a truly remarkable and unique red blend worthy of the best Napa Valley has to offer.Vintage Notes: Following the very small 2015 harvest it was heartening to see the vines recover and bounce back to produce not only extremely high quality fruit but also some bounty in 2016! Harvest was earlier than we expected and we observed optimum flavor and phenolic development progress as we harvested. With the ample rain that fell this past spring the soils were moist and the vines started growing in early spring and shoot growth was active. Flowering also turned out be optimum with very little frost so the individual grape varieties responded and good pollination allowed for a more typical crop. Across the board the flavors and acids were exceptional; very fresh fruit aromas and flavors were evident in the whites and a delicious balance evolved as the harvest proceeded. Acids are firm and pH is slightly lower so the wines should be well-structured with very good aging potential. During harvest we saw the reds evolve every day as the skins softened the tannins became more velvety and the grapes came into their own. This is an exciting vintage with a lot to like!
item.summary: 98 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.title: 2016 Paradiso - Magnum
item.description: This beautiful Bordeaux blend uses all five of the classic Bordeaux grape varieties bringing the flavors and characters of the individual grapes into a fabulous expression of cellar-worthy Cabernet Sauvignon wine. With the ample rain that fell this past spring the soils were moist and the vines started growing in early spring and shoot growth was active. Flowering also turned out be optimum with very little frost so the individual grape varieties responded and good pollination allowed for a more typical crop. Across the board the flavors and acids were exceptional; very fresh fruit aromas and flavors were evident in the whites and a delicious balance evolved as the harvest proceeded. Acids are firm and pH is slightly lower so the wines should be well-structured with very good aging potential. During harvest we saw the reds evolve every day as the skins softened the tannins became more velvety and the grapes came into their own. This is an exciting vintage with a lot to like!
item.summary: 98 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.title: 2016 Preston Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Following the very small 2015 harvest it was heartening to see the vines recover and bounce back to produce not only extremely high quality fruit but also some bounty in 2016!Vineyard Notes:The Preston Vineyard is located in the Rutherford Appellation where some of the finest Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. This was one of the first cabernet vineyards that Dario Sattui was drawn to in the early years. It is a very small region of Napa known for its gravelly soils which produce rich alluring and opulent red wines with fine-grained tannins and incredible complexity. The alluvial soils from Mount St. John have washed down from the hills over millennia to create a unique layering of weathered rock and gravel mixed with clay. The vines are 40-plus years old 10’ X 8’ spacing and trained to a divided canopy or “Quad”. The trellis allows ample light penetration on the fruit creating perfect flavor development and excellent maturity in the grapes at harvest. (Limit: 6 per person)
item.summary: 93 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2016 Select Late Harvest Riesling Anderson Valley
item.description: Though it is packaged in a small bottle this wine packs a big punch! (375 mL bottle) Vineyard Notes:Our 2016 Late Harvest Riesling sources fruit grown at our estate vineyard in Anderson Valley surrounded on three sides by rolling hills and low mountains and open to the west through majestic old- and second-growth redwoods to the Pacific Ocean along the Navarro River. With the coastal influence keeping temperatures cool grapes are allowed to develop slowly ripen evenly and develop their characteristically exotic flavors over time while preserving acidity. This vineyard is planted utilizing a VSP trellis system which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increases their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.The grapes were fully infected with the noble rot (botrytis cinerea) a fungus which naturally increases sugars. Depending on the conditions botrytis can be either beneficial or devastating to grapes. In its benevolent form over a period of cool mornings and warm afternoons the grapes shrivel concentrating and intensifying both sugar and flavor. The grape's acid level remains high however which prevents the resulting wines from being cloyingly sweet.
item.summary: BEST DESSERT WINE, 96 POINTS & PLATINUM - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2016 Vangone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Vangone Vineyards adjacent to Rector Reservoir and tucked in the hills between Atlas Peak and Oakville with elevation from 900 feet to 1500 feet above the valley floor is a new vineyard (established in 2012) that spent little time hesitating before it spread its wings and produced amazingly balanced and complex fruit. Just below the Stagecoach property and across from Dalle Valle lies 103 acres of which approximately 15 acres are planted of volcanic type soils and several micro-climates that provide the ultimate conditions for growing the high quality Bordeaux varietals of Cabernet Sauvignon Cabernet Franc and a small amount of Petit Verdot. A variety of clones and rootstocks were carefully selected to create the best possible outcome from their location in the vineyard. The fruit is typically dark in color with a deep powerful profile laced with hints of earth and high-toned structure.(Limit: 2 per person)
item.summary: WINE OF THE YEAR, 98 POINTS & PLATINUM - San Diego International Wine Competition

item.title: 2016 Vin Santo Monastero Di Coriano
item.description: Winemaking Notes:After harvest, Malvasia del Chianti and Trebbiano Toscano grapes are brought to a well-ventilated and protected room where they are laid out on mats to dry for many months in a process referred to as “passito.”These grapes are harvested before they overripen to retain acidity which helps to balance out the sweetness of the final product. The ensuing desiccation results in concentrated sugars and once they have reached their desired sugar level they are pressed. The must is then placed into small barrels made of chestnut and cherry wood where a slow fermentation and long maturation takes place. As the rooms increase in temperature during the spring the Vin Santo fermentation begins It is a long and slow fermentation that can rise and fall with the seasons and can take up to four years to complete.(Limit: 3 per person)

item.title: 2016 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon - Double Magnum
item.description: Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton Loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’ and rows are slightly north of east-west and grown to a VSP trellis. These well-drained gravelly soils promote early-ripening and optimum maturity and they are often the first Cabernet grapes of the harvest. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012.
item.summary: 97 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.summary: 97 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.title: 2017 Anderson Valley Pinot Noir - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: The Anderson Valley is located in the rolling hills of the coastal region of Mendocino County about two hours north of San Francisco. Only fifteen miles long half the length of Napa Valley this beautiful valley is home to a unique group of vineyards that produce a broad range of excellent wines including Burgundian varietals like Pinot Noir. The climate is significantly influenced by its proximity to the Pacific Ocean and is one of the coolest AVAs in the state as well as getting about 40 inches of rain each year also more than most wine regions.We source grapes for our Anderson Valley Pinot Noir from our very own estate ranch in Boonville. We have 11.6 acres divided into 5 small blocks, each of which are planted with different Pinot Noir clones or field selection. Clone 115, 667 and 777 dark pigments and rich structure, and pure aromas, and the Calera selection comes from cuttings from a true Burgundian clone form Josh Jenson’s Mt Harlan Vineyard, as well as another selection from DRC which offer more seductive complexities.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 92 POINTS & GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.title: 2017 Blanc De Noir
item.description: Each sip is delightfully balanced with a refreshing acidity and a hint of natural sweetness accompanied by its subtle creamy texture and effervescence.Vineyard Notes: Our 2017 Blanc de Noir is made from 100% Pinot Noir grapes that were grown from our Estate Vineyard “Boonville Ranch” in Anderson Valley Mendocino County. This appellation is ideal for producing high quality sparkling wines because of it’s proximately to the Pacific Ocean. The cool coastal climate allows the grapes to ripen slowly and retain their acidity levels an essential quality needed for sparkling wines.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are hand-harvested at night into ½ ton bins arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the “free run juice” is separated from the “press juice”. The juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks. After primary fermentation the resulting wine is “bone dry” (no residual grape sugar) then the “Tirage” bottling occurs where it undergoes the secondary fermentation in the bottle following the French “Méthode Champenoise”. Following the aging process bottles are transferred into riddling bins where they undergo a month long process of slight turns which gradually move the yeast lees to the cork. Once completed the bottles undergo the disgorging process where they are inverted the necks frozen to ensure the sediment is removed and then finished with the cork and packaging.At this point the champagne is ready to be enjoyed!
item.summary: BEST SPARKLING WINE, 94 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2017 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Carsi Vineyard lies about thirteen miles south of the winery in a wide flat basin just north of the town of Napa. It's a cooler zone of heavier soils where Chardonnay does exceptionally well. V. Sattui purchased the land in 1989 and invested heavily in soil amendments fertilization and trellising of the existing vines before naming it after my great-grandfather Vittorio's Italian village in the mountains above Genoa. We began to produce some excellent Chardonnays in just a short time.Winemaking Notes: The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into 100% French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay from this vineyard into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouthfeel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic and will age on its lees for ten months until racked out for blending and bottling.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 91 POINTS & 2 PUFFS - Connoisseurs' Guide

item.title: 2017 Los Carneros Chardonnay - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Our 2017 Los Carneros Chardonnay was crafted with fruit from our estate vineyard, Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This cool appellation overlooks the San Pablo Bay, where summer average temperatures range from 50º to 90ºF, making it an ideal site for Burgundian varietals. The cool summer nights allow the fruit to retain its acidity while warmer days bring the maturity to perfection. These vines are farmed utilizing a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.Winemaking Notes: The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into 100% French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay from this vineyard into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouthfeel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic and will age on its lees for ten months until racked out for blending and bottling.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 93 POINTS & GOLD - Sommelier Challenge

item.title: 2017 Los Carneros Pinot Noir - Magnum
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2017 Los Carneros Pinot Noir is a glorious representation of this world renowned viticultural area. The fruit for this wine comes from our estate vineyard, Henry Ranch, located along Carneros Creek and adjacent to the Mt. Veeder AVA. It is planted to four different clones, Dijon selections 115 and 777, clone 828 and Pommard clone 5, all grafted to 44-53 rootstocks on a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system. The VSP trellis forces clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions. Summer average temperatures range from 50º to 90ºF which makes it ideal site for these varietals. Cool summer nights retain the acidity and hot days bring the maturity to perfection.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is RC212. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.1.5L Magnum: Equivalent to two standard 750ml bottles. Serves 6-8 people.
item.summary: 96 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco International Wine Competition

item.title: 2017 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes: This wine comes from Gary & Melody Morisoli’s Vineyard located in the heart of the famed “Rutherford Bench” below Mt. St. John in the Mayacamas range. Gary is a third-generation farmer in a special part of Napa Valley known for well-drained Bale Clay Loam gravelly soils producing fine- grain supple tannins in the wine and where some of the best Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. The vine rows are oriented on a direction that is slightly North-West by South-East with a “V-trellis” that allows optimum filtered light to hit the ripening grape clusters. Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon is grafted to 110R rootstock on this very cobbly and rocky ground. Gary typically uses very limited irrigation during the growing season essentially dry-farming in most years. The vines were planted in 1990 and V. Sattui has been harvesting these grape to make a single-vineyard designate since the first small harvest of 1993.(Limit: 1 per person)
item.summary: 97 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2017 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: The 2017 wine quality shows a lot of bright acidity and fresh varietal aromas in the white wines and deep color sweet fruit flavors and firm tannin structure in the reds. Yields were good with a few varieties being a bit above average and some below historical production. Vineyard Notes:Located in the rugged Mayacamas Mountains at elevations ranging from 1250-1400 ft. our Mt. Veeder Estate is situated in a unique microclimate offering cooler temperatures during the day with warmer temperatures at night. Planted on ancient marine soils the fruit in this vineyard develops slowly and steadily until full phenolic ripeness is reached. Often the very last of our vineyards to be harvested; our Mt. Veeder Estate offers small yields of deeply pigmented intensely flavored fruit which produce wines of complexity power and elegance that speak to their provenance year after year.(Limit: 2 per person)
item.summary: 91 POINTS - James Suckling

item.title: 2017 Prestige Cuvée Brut
item.description: Vineyard Notes:For our 2017 Prestige Cuvee Brut we used a blend of 73% Chardonnay and 27% Pinot Noir from grapes that were grown in Napa Valley. This appellation is the perfect climate for producing high quality sparkling wines because of the cooling influence of the San Francisco Bay. The moderate coastal climate allows the grapes to ripen slowly and retain their acidity levels an essential quality needed for sparkling wines.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are hand-harvested at night into ½ ton bins arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the “free run juice” is separated from the “press juice”. The juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks. After primary fermentation the resulting wine is “bone dry” (no residual grape sugar) then the “Tirage” bottling occurs where it undergoes the secondary fermentation in the bottle following the French “Method Champenoise”. Following the aging process bottles are transferred into riddling bins where they undergo a month long process of slight turns which gradually move the yeast lees to the cork. Once completed the bottles undergo the disgorging process where they are inverted the necks frozen to ensure the sediment is removed and then finished with the cork and packaging. At this point the champagne is ready to be enjoyed!

item.title: 2018 Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2018 Napa Valley Cabernet is sourced from many of our best estate and grower vineyards in the Napa Valley and its sub-appellations.; Rutherford is famous for its dusty earthy qualities and fragrant black cherry fruit (45%). Our Estate “Vittorio’s Vineyard” adjacent to the winery provides smooth Cabernet Sauvignon and the powerful intensity of Petit Verdot to the blend (23%) .Mt Veeder provides excellent color and supple tannins (18%); Coombsville brings intense black color and fine-grain tannins (14%).

item.title: 2018 Paradiso
item.description: Paradiso is the proprietary name for our red “Meritage” a Bordeaux-style blended wine that changes in varietal composition from vintage to vintage. "Based on 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 31% Merlot, and the rest a mix of Malbec, Petit Verdot, and Cabernet Franc, the 2018 Red Blend Paradiso sports a dense purple hue as well as impressive notes of black and blue fruits, graphite, spring flowers, and fresh bouquet garni. This carries to a medium to full-bodied Red Blend with a rounded, supple mouthfeel, ripe tannins, and outstanding length..." - Jeb Dunnuck

item.title: 2018 Prestige Cuvée Brut Rosé
item.description: Vineyard Notes:For our Prestige Cuvée Brut Rosé we used a blend of 84% Pinot Noir and 16% Chardonnay from grapes grown from our estate vineyards along the North Coast.
