item.summary: 91 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2018 Terra Forza Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Our 2018 Terra Forza Cabernet Sauvignon is made in an engaging style with dark ruby color and layered flavors of cherry, raspberry, and sage. This Cabernet is full-bodied and has a plush lingering finish with well-integrated tannins - perfect for everyday enjoyment. Dedicated to Sustainability - Committed to Change:Beyond our own commitments towards environmental resiliency and stewardship, V. Sattui Winery is also supportive of organizations making positive changes for the environment. With the sale of every bottle of 2018 Napa Valley Terra Forza (Strong Earth), V. Sattui will donate $1 towards Napa Valley Grapegrowers, a non-profit, 501(c)(3) organization actively engaging in environmental and educational programs such as water conservation, climate-smart farming techniques and regenerative practices, and wildfire preparedness. Thank you for joining us in these efforts through your purchase of this special Cabernet.Vineyard Notes:This eloquent blend, incorporating all five noble Bordeaux varieties, showcases the opulence of Napa Valley. We sought to create a wine that was as robust as the Valley’s reputation incorporating power house varietals from our estate vineyards in St. Helena and Mount Veeder as well as contributions from our vineyard sources in Rutherford.
item.summary: 94 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2018 Vangone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Vangone Vineyard is located on the bench land above a steep cliff on the east side of the Napa Valley, 1200 feet above the valley floor. This unique vineyard site features gravelly, volcanic soils and a southwestern facing sun exposure. To match site and soil conditions, Cabernet clones 191m 4 and 169 were densely planted on 6’ x 4’ spacing to ensure ideal terroir for top quality Mountain Cabernet.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel, with a small amount in 60 gallon barrels for “barrel-fermentation”; tank peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Wine Competition

item.title: 2018 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’ and rows are slightly north of east-west and grown to a VSP trellis. These well-drained gravelly soils promote early-ripening and optimum maturity and they are often the first Cabernet grapes of the harvest. Vittorio’s Vineyard has been farmed organically since 2009 and was certified as “Organically- Farmed” by the CCOF in 2012.
item.summary: 94 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2019 Amador Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Sustainable farming at its best! Amador Ridge Vineyard is located just outside of Sutter Creek on an ancient mud-slide of red cobbly-loam soil. The head-trained Zinfandel is grafted to St. George rootstock on an east facing slope allowing the grower to dry farm in most seasons and to irrigate the vines only in exceptionally dry years.John Murrill’s Zinfandel vines at Amador Ridge Vineyard are located just outside of Sutter Creek on an ancient mud-slide of red cobbly-loam soil. The head-trained Zinfandel is grafted to St. George rootstock on an east-facing slope allowing him to dry-farm in most seasons and to irrigate the vines only in exceptionally dry years. John practices sustainable farming and yield are only 2 to 2 ½ tons per acre on average.
item.summary: 92 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2019 Collins Family Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Collins Family Block 20 Zinfandel was planted in 1923 on an alluvial fan on the north end of the St. Helena Appellation and is adjacent to the Historic Bale Gristmill. The traditional head-trained vines are grafted to St. George rootstock and this years’ harvest marks the vines 96th birthday! The yields average less than 3 tons per acre and the soil is very well-drained with lots of large stones and gravel that has been washed down from the steep Mayacamas Mountain Range to the West.
item.summary: 92 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2019 Dry Creek Zinfandel
item.description: Dry Creek Valley in Sonoma County is recognized as one of the top growing regions for Zinfandel in California. The hot summer days produce fruit flavors that are fully developed and complex while the proximity to the Pacific Ocean fog provides for rapid cooling in the evening which maintains excellent acid balance in the grapes and wine.

item.title: 2019 Gilsson Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Gilsson Vineyard is located along the Eastern section of the Russian River Valley Appellation in Sonoma County. The vines were planted in the early 1960s to St. George rootstock and are head-trained and spur-pruned. The soils consist of old weathered “Laughlin Series” clay loam. The nutrients from these soils are tightly bound to microscopic clay particles and thus are not readily available which make the vines work harder for survival. This struggle translates to a lower fruit production per vine but higher quality grapes with concentrated flavors.Fingers of Pacific fog follow the Russian River inland cooling its watershed ahead of the surrounding terrain and making the area markedly cooler. This appellation already well-revered for its Pinot Noirs has been very consistent with producing well-bred and extracted Zinfandels as well most notably DeLoach, J. Rochioli and Hartford among others. Gilsson Vineyard actually is in an area where two appellations intersect Russian River and Chalk Hill so the vineyard experiences not only cooling fog but chalky soil as well the best of both.
item.summary: 91 POINTS & 2 PUFFS - Connoisseurs' Guide

item.title: 2019 Katarina Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2019 Katarina Pinot Noir sources grapes from our estate vineyard in the Russian River Valley. This AVA is strongly influenced by two key factors; weather and geology. The coastal influence from the Pacific Ocean moderates the temperatures as much as 35 to 40 degrees from its daytime high. This climate promotes full flavor maturity over an extended growing season while allowing the fruit to retain its natural acidity. The combination of fractured sandstone and sandy loam soils allow the vineyards to retain water and heat which help to produce smooth round wines with less acidity that are highly aromatic.

item.title: 2019 Monastero Le Vallesi Sangiovese
item.description: This classic Italian red wine is made from the Sangiovese grape variety the mainstay of the Tuscan grapes that are grown in the rugged hills of Italy's famed Chianti Region in Italy. Monastero Le Vallesi a monastery built by Augustinian monks prior to the year 1000 on a hillside near Siena in the Chianti area of Tuscany is now owned by Dario Sattui proprietor of V. Sattui Winery. He is restoring the property and making small lots of wine and olive oil that are only sold at V. Sattui Winery.

item.title: 2019 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:This wine comes from Gary & Melody Morisoli’s Vineyard located in the heart of the famed “Rutherford Bench” below Mt. St. John in the Mayacamas range. Gary is a third-generation farmer in a special part of Napa Valley known for well-drained Bale Clay Loam gravelly soils producing fine- grain supple tannins in the wine and where some of the best Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. The vine rows are oriented on a direction that is slightly North-west by South-East with a “V-trellis” that allows optimum filtered light to hit the ripening grape clusters. Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon is grafted to 110R rootstock on this very cobbly and rocky ground. Gary typically uses very limited irrigation during the growing season essentially dry-farming in most years. The vines were planted in 1990 and V. Sattui has been harvesting these grape to make a single-vineyard designate since the first small harvest of 1993. Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel, with a small amount in 60-gallon barrels for “barrel-fermentation”; tank peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine, we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary: 98 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2019 Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Mounts Vineyard has been a source of premium wine grapes for three generations in the Dry Creek Valley. With experience gained from over 50 years of farming the same ground the Mounts Family uses this knowledge of each block’s unique exposure soil texture and depth when choosing rootstock clone and trellis design. This careful consideration allows for excellent vine balance giving the maximum expression of fruit character balance and structure to the Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel.

item.title: 2019 Mt. Veeder Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The rugged mountain elevations have complex marine Franciscan Formation soils with metamorphosed marine sediments such as Haire loam Cole silt loam Fagan clay loam and Felton gravelly loam with small amounts of more recent Sonoma Volcanic soils. The cool Mt. Veeder appellation overlooking the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly developing incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes. We have Cabernet clones 4 7 337 and 191 planted to these steep hills grafted to 1103P and 101-14 rootstock. The vines are spaced at 9 ft. between rows and 4 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley and in most years it is last cabernet harvested for V. Sattui.
item.summary: 94 POINTS - Wine & Spirits Magazine

item.title: 2019 Napa Valley Grenache
item.description: The components of our 2019 Napa Valley Grenache are sourced completely from our own estate ranches: Carsi Vineyard in Yountville and Vittorio’s Vineyard in St. Helena. We use two different clones of Grenache Alban and 362 which are planted on steep hills and grafted to rootstocks 1103-P and 101-14. While this wine is made of predominantly Grenache we sought to blend in just a touch of Syrah and Alicante Bouschet which aid in providing some dark fruit and slightly peppery characteristics. All of our vines are spaced at 7ft. between the rows and 4ft. between the vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a v. vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.
item.summary: 93 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2019 Napa Valley Merlot
item.description: Vineyard Notes: The cool Mt. Veeder appellation, overlooking the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly, developing incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes. Rugged mountain elevations have complex, marine Franciscan Formation soils with metamorphosed marine sediments, such as Haire loam, Cole silt loam, Fagan clay loam, and Felton gravelly loam with small amounts of more recent Sonoma Volcanic soils. Merlot clones 181, and 18 are planted to these steep hills, grafted to 101-14 rootstock. The vines are spaced at 7 ft. between rows and 5 ft. between vines. Row direction is generally North-South on a vertical trellis system. This special area has the longest growing season and the lowest yields in Napa Valley.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine, we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.

item.title: 2019 Napa Valley Petite Sirah
item.description: There is no doubt that our 2019 Petite Sirah is here to make a statement. It is bursting with ripe fruit character reflective of the grapes that were sourced from some of our favorite vineyards: Oles Vineyard in St. Helena AVA and Allias Vineyard located in Rutherford and Mounts Vineyard over in Dry Creek Valley. Though these vineyards are found in different viticultural regions they are all optimally located near coastal mountain ranges which serve as a conduit for the cool costal air and fog to come in at night. While long warm days allow for the fruit to fully ripen the evenings allow grapes to mature slowly and retain the perfect acidity and balance.Vintage
item.summary: BEST PETITE SIRAH; 94 Points | Platinum - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2019 Paradiso
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Paradiso is the proprietary name for our red “Meritage” - a Bordeaux-style blend that changes in varietal composition from vintage to vintage. In an homage to this type of wine, we have included five of classic grape varietals, with no single variety making up more than 90% of the blend. The beauty of this is that no one varietal stands out, but that each one is harmoniously balanced by the others. These wines are prized for the smooth, silky textures and complex, full-bodied structure. They age beautifully for decades; however, most are also very drinkable in their younger years.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where a peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine, we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary: BEST BORDEAUX-STYLE BLEND, 96 POINTS & PLATINUM - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2019 Reserve Stock Napa Valley Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2019 Reserve Napa Valley Chardonnay is a beautifully balanced blend, crafted using fruit from our estate properties Hibbard Ranch (53%) in Los Carneros and Carsi Vineyard (47%) in Yountville. These properties are located toward the cool, southern end of Napa Valley where fog from the San Pablo Bay helps to regulate temperature throughout the growing season. The coastal influence of the bay keeps daytime temperatures cool, allowing grapes to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop full varietal flavors over time while preserving acidity.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into 100% new French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds, while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouthfeel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic and will age on its lees for nine months until racked out for blending and bottling.
item.summary: 93 POINTS - James Suckling

item.title: 2019 Reserve Stock Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:For our 2019 Reserve Stock Pinot Noir we created a blend that sourced fruit from our estate vineyards Hibbard Ranch located in Los Carneros, Napa Valley and Collina d’ Oro Vineyard, nestled along the Russian River in Sonoma County. Both appellations are in close proximity to marine climates, allowing the morning fog to inhibit significant temperature rises in the morning. With the coastal influence keeping temperatures cool, and chance of late-season rain minimal, the grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop fruit flavors over time while preserving acidity.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is RC212. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine, we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary: DOUBLE GOLD - San Francisco Chronicle Wine Competition

item.title: 2019 Rutherford Dust Up Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:This very limited and special bottling of Cabernet Sauvignon comes from a blend of Gary Morisoli’s vineyard on Niebaum Lane and his brother, Mike Morisoli’s vineyard, just a stone’s throw away. Mike and Gary are 3rd generation Napa Valley grape growers, beginning with the Morisoli Family planted grapes in western Rutherford in early 1950’s. The vineyards are located in the heart of the famous “Rutherford Bench”, an area of well-drained, alluvial soils below Mt. St. John that produce fine grain “dusty” and supple tannins and where some of the most notable Cabernet Sauvignon in Napa Valley is grown. It is a tribute to their family’s hard work and dedication to growing the finest grapes in Napa Valley.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary: 95 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2019 Sattui Family Red
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2019 Sattui Family Red is a delightful combination of fruit that has been sourced from our three estate properties: Carsi Vineyard, Vittorio’s Vineyard, and Hibbard Ranch. Each appellation brings its own characteristic terroir to the finalized blend while a few select varietals intermingle beautifully in a yummy easy drinking and satisfying wine - perfect for any day of the week.

item.title: 2019 Vangone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Vangone Vineyard is located on top of a narrow eastern bench high above the Napa Valley, 1200 feet above the valley floor. This unique vineyard site features gravelly, volcanic soils and a southwestern facing sun exposure. To match site and soil conditions, Cabernet clones 191, 4 and 169 were densely planted on 6’ x 4’ spacing to ensure ideal terroir for top quality Mountain Cabernet
item.summary: 95 POINTS & DOUBLE GOLD - American Fine Wine Competition

item.title: 2019 Vittorio's Vineyard Petit Verdot
item.description:
Vineyards Notes:Our Petit Verdot grapes are grown on property at our St. Helena estate, Vittorio’s Vineyard. This property was named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather, who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years. The vines are spaced at 7’ x 5’, and rows are slightly North of East-West and grown to a VSP trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening. Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.
For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. item.summary: BEST PETIT VERDOT, 90 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2020 Bacci (red Blend)
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Bacci is a proprietary blend that incorporates our three estate properties: Carsi Vineyard, Vittorio’s Vineyard, and Hibbard Ranch. We sought out to create a unique blend that showcased some of our favorite varietals grown in these vineyards that demonstrate luscious fresh fruit flavor with soft round tannins. This wine has every bit of character that one would want in a red wine without the need to wait for aging!

item.title: 2020 Cara Chardonnay
item.description: "With this special bottling of Chardonnay I dedicate this wine to my wife Cara. Like Katarina before her Cara is a very strong forthright determined and loving woman. Cara and I met as co-workers here at V. Sattui Winery 41 years ago and two years later we were married! I marvel and celebrate strong women that balance family work and community and that is the inspiration behind the naming of this wine!" - V. Sattui Winery President Tom DaviesVineyard Notes:Our 2020 Cara Chardonnay is a unique blend of fruit sourced from our estate properties Hibbard Ranch (32%) in Los Carneros and Carsi Vineyard (68%) in Yountville. These properties are located toward the cool southern end of Napa Valley where fog from the San Pablo Bay helps regulate temperature throughout the growing season. The coastal influence of the bay keeps daytime temperatures cool allowing grapes to develop slowly ripen evenly and develop full varietal flavors.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into 100% French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay juice into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouthfeel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic and will age on its lees for nine months until racked out for blending and bottling.

item.title: 2020 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay sources fruit solely from our estate vineyard located in Yountville. It is a 27-acre vineyard named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace the Italian hillside village of Carsi. Yountville has a combination of soil types and microclimates that make this location perfect for growing different varietals. There are three Chardonnay blocks each planted to showcase a unique clone of Chardonnay. Clones 95 and 76 are Dijon clones which are lower yielding with small clusters and concentrated flavors while clone 809 characteristically has a more floral aroma. These Chardonnay vines were planted in 1999 on a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions. Summer average temperatures range from 50 to 90 F which makes it ideal site for these varietals. Cool summer nights retain the acidity and hot days bring the maturity to perfection.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, 43and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50F. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay from this vineyard into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, we will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouthfeel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic and will age on its lees for nine months until racked out for blending and bottling.
item.summary: BEST CHARDONNAY; 95 Points & Platinum - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2020 Collina D'oro Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our Estate vineyard Collina d'Oro rests in the Russian River Valley within Sonoma County. This site is perfectly suited for Chardonnay due to the coastal fog influence and the "Gold Ridge" sandy loam soils. The vineyard gets its name from these soils which means "Hills of Gold" in Italian. The Russian River Valley is strongly influenced by two key factors; weather and geology. The coastal influence from the Pacific Ocean moderates the temperatures as much as 35 to 40 degrees from its daytime high. This climate promotes full flavor maturity over an extended growing season while allowing the fruit to retain its natural acidity. The combination of fractured sandstone and sandy loam soils allow the vineyards to retain water and heat which help to produce smooth round wines with less acidity that are highly aromatic. item.summary: 94 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2020 Duarte Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard NotesThe Duarte Vineyard consists of two small Zinfandel blocks one planted in 1981 and the other in 2014 to 5BB rootstock. It is dry farmed in most years and the soils are very sandy and extremely well-drained. The warmer summer temperatures are moderated with strong and cooling breezes from the bay to create the perfect growing conditions for these vines.
item.summary: NEW VINTAGE!

item.title: 2020 Entanglement (gsm)
item.description: Vineyards Notes: Our Entanglement is a delightful blend featuring Grenache, Syrah and Mourvédre (GSM). Our Grenache and Syrah are sourced from our Carsi Vineyard estate located in Yountville. This 27-acre vineyard was named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. Yountville has a combination of soil types and micro climates that make this location perfect for growing different varietals. Our Mourvédre comes from Vittorio’s Vineyard located at our estate in St Helena, where only half an acre is planted. Last, but certainly not least we incorporate a touch of our Petite Sirah, which adds a dash of its characteristic rich, purple color, and recognizably deep fruity flavor.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Once these are at an optimum in the wine we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary:
PRE-RELEASE!
This wine is pre-released for the May 2023 Wine-of-the-Month Club and is not yet available for purchase outside the club.

item.title: 2020 La Merica
item.description: About La Merica: Our 2020 La Merica celebrates and honors our winery’s Italian heritage with a modern interpretation of a classic pre-prohibition blend. Though proprietary by nature this wine is largely composed from grape varietals sourced from our estate vineyards Carsi Vineyard and Hibbard Ranch. The star players in this powerhouse blend are some of the key Rhone varietals like Syrah, Petite Sirah, and Grenache along with a few unlikely candidates mixed in to spice things up!“I wanted to make a wine that celebrated and honored our winery’s Italian heritage with a modern interpretation of a classic pre-prohibition blend. For over 150 years in California Petite Sirah and Zinfandel have been planted side-by-side and are natural blending partners – with Petite Sirah providing the color spice and structure and Zinfandel contributing its varietal distinctive dark berry fruit and aromas. Our new-world blend takes these classic grapes and steers away from the rustic old-world style and boldly produces a wine filled with deeply dark-fruited flavors inky-purple color and supple and lingering textures.In searching for name for this special wine I came across a paper given to me by Dr. Victor Geraci a noted wine historian and professor at UC Berkeley during our 125th Anniversary of V. Sattui in 2010. In his paper he spoke of the mass Italian immigration of the late 1800s and early 1900s with many of these immigrants finding a home and work in the nascent California winegrowing business. In the dialect of their native tongue they affectionately referred to their new home in America as La Merica.La Merica honors these brave men women and children that left a home filled with poverty and political hardship to a new home filled with hope and opportunity. I want this wine to embrace the importance of immigration not only as the foundation and building blocks of our great country but also for our future and continued greatness as a nation of immigrants. La Merica rejoices everything that is great about America: Freedom Transparency Opportunity Choice Due Process Acceptance and Diversity.” – V. Sattui President Tom Davies
item.summary: 92 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2020 Napa Valley Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2020 Napa Valley Chardonnay is made from a delightful blend of our estate vineyard fruit. A majority (62%) of which comes from Hibbard Ranch located in Los Carneros. This appellation lies on the border of both Napa and Sonoma Counties but unlike other cool-climate AVA’s in Sonoma County Los Carneros receives much less rainfall and it is farther from the ocean. The area’s dense clay soils are not particularly deep or fertile and these factors when combined create a powerful Chardonnay with concentrated fruit flavors.The remainder of the blend (38%) is sourced from Carsi Vineyard just down the road in Yountville. It is a 27-acre vineyard named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace the Italian hillside village of Carsi. This appellation is one of the coolest wine growing regions in Napa Valley which contributes to a long growing season and full-flavored fruit.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into 100% French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay juice into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouthfeel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic and will age on its lees for nine months until racked out for blending and bottling.
item.summary: SWEEPSTAKES WINNER - SF Chronicle Wine Competition

item.title: 2020 Napa Valley Syrah
item.description: Our 2020 Napa Valley Syrah utilizes four different clones that are grown in three different appellations throughout Napa Valley. With careful consideration we’ve planted each clone in its optimal climate so that our finished wine displays beautiful aromatics with rich full-bodied complexity and strong tannin structure.Vittorio’s Vineyard (clones 470 and 383) in St. Helena is named in honor of Dario Sattui’s great-grandfather who founded the original V. Sattui Winery in San Francisco’s North Beach neighborhood in 1885. Its Pleasanton loam soils are derived from meanderings of an ancient stream which laid down layers of gravel and silt loams over thousands of years.Just down the road in Yountville at Carsi Vineyard (clone 174) named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace- the Italian hillside village of Carsi there is a combination of soil types and microclimates that make this location perfect for growing different varietals.Last but certainly not least we have a single acre of Syrah planted at our estate ranch in Mt. Veeder (clone 877) where the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly developing incredibly deep red color and rich concentration of flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes.
item.summary: Best Syrah; 94 Points & Platinum - Monterey Int'l Wine Comp.

item.title: 2020 Pilgrim Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Pilgrim Vineyard is a 12-acre parcel located in the Lodi AVA, which lies just between Sacramento and Stockton, extending east until it runs into the Sierra Foothills AVA. This lovely vineyard is owned by Joel and Martine Herche, who after moving sixteen times in sixteen years, ended their pilgrimage in 1998 by finally settling down on this vineyard. They playfully named it for John Bunyan’s work, “The Pilgrim’s Progress”. The vines are certified to be at least 70 years old, but are reputed to be much older and are flourishing. Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50 F. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where a peak temperature is typically 92 0F; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary: 91 Points & Gold - Monterey Int'l Wine Competition

item.title: 2020 Quaglia Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Tiny Quaglia (Italian for “quail”) Vineyard is actually two separate parcels in St. Helena about a mile apart. One parcel is on Spring Street on the west side of town; the other is on Pratt Avenue just north of town. When Ray Quaglia's forefathers acquired this land in the early 1930’s it had already been farmed for fifty years by the Valley's early Italian growers. Back in the day it was customary to plant "field blends" different grape varieties alongside each other which when picked altogether produced the blend that was desired in the bottle. Needless to say most of the vines are Zinfandel but there are varying amounts of Petite Sirah and Carignane throughout the vineyard as well for added color and flavor complexity.
item.summary: NEW VINTAGE

item.title: 2020 Ramazzotti Vineyard Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The head-trained vines from Ramazzotti Vineyard located in Sonoma County’s Dry Creek Valley were planted in 1982 from the Mazzoni clone thought to be one of the original heritage clones dating back to the mid- 19th century. It is on a southwest-facing slope above the fog line allowing the afternoon sun to fully ripen the grapes. Its shallow soils and an impenetrable layer of rock below naturally balance the vines so they’ve never overproduced. Although the yields per acre are miniscule the resulting wines are expansive works of art. Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where a peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary: 93 POINTS & "CELLAR SELECTION" - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2020 Russian River Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our Russian River Pinot Noir is composed of grapes from our estate vineyard which is nestled among the rolling hillsides that wind alongside the Russian River in Sonoma County. The Russian River Valley is strongly influenced by two key factors; weather and geology. The coastal influence from the Pacific Ocean moderates the temperatures as much as 35 to 40 degrees from its daytime high. This climate promotes full flavor maturity over an extended growing season while allowing the fruit to retain its natural acidity. The combination of fractured sandstone and sandy loam soils allow the vineyards to retain water and heat which help to produce smooth round wines with less acidity and highly aromatic.

item.title: 2020 School House Creek Zinfandel
item.description: Vineyard Notes:School House Creek Vineyard is located in the northern end of Dry Creek Valley outside of Healdsburg near Lake Sonoma. The vines were planted in 1972 to St. George rootstock and are head-trained at 10’ by 8’ spacing. The soils consist of weathered gravelly loam on a well-drained alluvial bench above the valley floor. They are “dry-farmed” meaning grown without irrigation which limits vine growth but intensifies grape flavor.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. They are “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to tank. The initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Multiple lots were fermented in stainless steel tank where a peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. The wine is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months.
item.summary: 93 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2021 Boonville Ranch Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:We source grapes for our Anderson Valley Pinot Noir from our very own estate ranch in Boonville. We have 11.6 acres divided into 5 small blocks each of which are planted with different Pinot Noir clones or field selection. Clone 115 667 and 777 dark pigments and rich structure and pure aromas and the Calera selection comes from cuttings from a true Burgundian clone form Josh Jenson’s Mt Harlan Vineyard as well as another selection from DRC which offer more seductive complexities.The Anderson Valley is located in the rolling hills of the coastal region of Mendocino County about two hours north of San Francisco. Only fifteen miles long half the length of Napa Valley this beautiful valley is home to a unique group of vineyards that produce a broad range of excellent wines including Burgundian varietals like Pinot Noir. The climate is significantly influenced by its proximity to the Pacific Ocean and is one of the coolest AVAs in the state as well as getting about 40 inches of rain each year also more than most wine regions.Winemaking Notes: The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. About 80% of the fruit is “de-stemmed”, berry sorted and crushed to an open top stainless-steel tank. The remaining 20% of the fruit is added as whole clusters; these tend to ferment at a slower pace, preserving more fresh fruit aromas and soft tannins in the finished wine. Once all the fruit is in tank, the initial “cold-soak” (no fermentation) of the grapes is 3-4 days at 50ºF. Each vineyard block was fermented in different stainless-steel tanks where peak temperature is typically 92ºF; and the yeast strain is RC212. Once fermentation begins, the grape skins and solids rise to the surface because of the carbon dioxide gas that fermentation creates. The tank is lightly punched down twice a day to ensure the fruit cap, which is the source of color, is mixed with the fermenting juice. Not only does this aid in extracting color and tannins from the fruit cap, but also homogenizing tank fermentation temperature to preserve delicate aromas and flavors. The juice is tasted twice a day to evaluate the color and tannin extraction from the skins and seeds.For this wine we are looking for a careful balance of deep red pigment intensity, complexity of flavors and balance in the mid-palate, and overall tannin content. Once these are at an optimum in the wine, we drain the free-run juice from the skins to another tank and keep separate the hard press wine, which will be evaluated and aged separately. Once the new wine has settled in tank (3-4 days) we rack off the gross grape solids (lees) and move to barrels. The 2nd fermentation (called Malolactic) will then proceed in small barrels over several months."Fully ripe black cherry fruit is the driving force of this ample fairly fleshy youngster yet if made in a somewhat fuller style the wine is very well-structured and does not give itself over to over-the-top ripeness and maintains good varietal focus from start to finish. It is underpinned by enough tannin to argue for a few years of cellaring but it shows good fruity depth throughout its length and its closing drift to grippy astringency is not at all out of bounds for a wine of its age." - Connoisseurs' Guide
item.summary: BEST PINOT NOIR, 93 POINTS & GOLD - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2021 Boonville Ranch Riesling
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The grapes for this wine are grown in Anderson Valley which is only about 16 miles long and up to 1½ miles wide surrounded on three sides by rolling hills and low mountains and open to the west through majestic old- and second-growth redwoods to the Pacific Ocean along the Navarro River. With the coastal influence keeping temperatures cool grapes are allowed to develop slowly ripen evenly and develop their characteristically exotic flavors over time while preserving acidity. This vineyard is planted utilizing a VSP trellis system which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increases their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is ICVGRE. Before fermentation is complete, we halt fermentation by chilling the tank, in order to leave a very small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.
item.summary: 91 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2021 Collina D'oro Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Collina d’Oro Vineyard is located in the Russian River AVA in Sonoma County. This region is famous for its unique “Gold Ridge soils and cool coastal influence perfect for Chardonnay and Pinot Noir. The Russian River Valley is strongly influenced by two key factors; weather and geology. The coastal influence from the Pacific Ocean moderates the temperatures as much as 35 to 40 degrees from its daytime high. This climate promotes full flavor maturity over an extended growing season while allowing the fruit to retain its natural acidity. The combination of fractured sandstone and sandy loam soils allow the vineyards to retain water and heat which help to produce smooth round wines with less acidity that are highly aromatic."Spot-on in its varietal focus and boasting plenty of pure red and black cherry fruit with accents of sweet slightly caramelly oak lending an extra bit of richness and range V. Sattui’s Collina d’Oro bottling is at once lively and nicely ripened with fine fruity energy and length. Albeit very young and structured to clearly benefit from age it is surprisingly easy to taste for an ambitious Pinot Noir that is barely a year old..." - Connoisseurs' Guide
item.summary: 94 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2021 Dancing Egg Riesling
item.description: Vineyard Notes: Our 2021 Mt. Veeder Dry Riesling was produced using estate grown fruit from only a single block at Hibbard Ranch located in the Mount Veeder sub-appellation of Napa Valley. The cool Mt. Veeder appellation overlooking the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly developing incredibly rich concentrated flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes. Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled the clear juice is then racked into our “egg-shaped” concrete tank and aged sur-lies for four months; the yeast strain is ICVGRE. This method of fermentation gives the wine a little roundness while preserving the fruit. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest fruitiest aromas and flavors.
item.summary: BEST OF SHOW White Wine; Best Riesling; 96 Points | Platinum - Winemaker Challenge

item.title: 2021 Los Carneros Chardonnay
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2021 Los Carneros Chardonnay was crafted using fruit from our estate vineyard, Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This cool appellation overlooks the San Pablo Bay, where summer average temperatures range from 50 to 90F, making it an ideal site for Burgundian varietals. The cool summer nights allow the fruit to retain its acidity while warmer days bring the maturity to perfection. These vines are farmed utilizing a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into 100% French oak barrels for fermentation. We typically divide the Chardonnay from this vineyard into four different lots; three of them will be inoculated with a different yeast strain; each one capable of producing different aromatic compounds while one lot will undergo a native fermentation with no yeast addition. Once primary fermentation has been completed, winemaking will determine which lots will go through malolactic fermentation, also referred to as secondary fermentation. The completion of malolactic fermentation will aid in providing a creamier texture with a fuller mouth-feel. All lots are stirred biweekly through malolactic and will age on its lees for nine months until racked out for blending and bottling.
item.summary: 95 POINTS - The Wine Independent

item.title: 2021 Los Carneros Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard NotesOur 2021 Los Carneros Pinot Noir is a glorious representation of this world-renowned viticultural area. The fruit for this wine comes from our estate vineyard Hibbard Ranch located along Carneros Creek and adjacent to the Mt. Veeder AVA. It is planted to four different clones Dijon selections 115 and 777 clone 828 and Pommard clone 5 all grafted to 44-53 rootstocks on a vertical shoot position (VSP) trellis system. The VSP trellis forces clusters to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions. Summer average temperatures range from 50 to 90 F which makes it ideal site for these varietals. Cool summer nights retain the acidity and hot days bring the maturity to perfection.

item.title: 2021 Muscat
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our ever-popular Muscat is crafted from 100% Estate grown grapes in Solano County. This county lies just South of Napa County and is known for its alluvial soils deposited on the flat valley floors over many years by rivers running through the area. Solano County enjoys a maritime climate due to the close proximity of the Sacramento Delta. Ocean breezes and fog from both Suisun Bay and San Pablo Bay help to cool the vineyards which extends the growing season and leads to grapes that produce balanced wines with good acidity and phenolic ripeness.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is ICVGRE. Before fermentation is complete, we halt fermentation by chilling the tank, in order to leave a small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2021 North Coast Semillon
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our 2021 North Coast Semillon sources fruit from both of our Estate properties in Anderson Valley Los Carneros in Napa Valley and Yountville in Napa Valley. With the coastal influence of the bay keeping temperatures cool and chance of late-season rain minimal grapes are allowed to develop slowly ripen evenly and develop fruit flavors over time while preserving acidity. These vineyards utilize a VSP trellis system for their vines which forces clusters of fruit to the outside of the canopy to increase their exposure to sunlight and enhance ripening under cool climate conditions.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 49º-55ºF; and the yeast strain is SL3. This is a special yeast strain, ideal for fermentations with varietals that are exceptionally aromatic to preserve these fruit forward characteristics. Once fermentation is complete, the wine is kept chilled and lightly filtered before bottling.
item.summary: 90 POINTS - Wine Enthusiast

item.title: 2021 Rosato Di Pinot Noir
item.description: Vineyard Notes:We source grapes for our Rosato di Pinot Noir from our very own estate ranch in Boonville. We have 11.6 acres divided into 5 small blocks each of which are planted with different Pinot Noir clones or field selection. Clone 115 667 and 777 dark pigments and rich structure and pure aromas and the Calera selection comes from cuttings from a true Burgundian clone form Josh Jenson’s Mt Harlan Vineyard as well as another selection from DRC which offer more seductive complexities.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is R2. Before fermentation is complete we halt fermentation by chilling the tank in order to leave a very small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2022 Bacci Bianco
item.description: Vineyard Notes Our 2022 Bacci Bianco is made from a delightful blend of our estate vineyard fruit. A majority of which comes from Hibbard Ranch (82%) located in Los Carneros. This appellation lies on the border of both Napa and Sonoma Counties, but unlike other cool-climate AVA’s in Sonoma County, Los Carneros receives much less rainfall, and it is farther from the ocean. The area’s dense, clay soils are not particularly deep or fertile, and these factors when combined create a powerful Chardonnay with concentrated fruit flavors. We also chose to incorporate a touch of fruit (18%) from our estate vineyard in Solano County. This county lies just South of Napa County, and is known for its alluvial soils, deposited on the flat valley floors over many years by rivers running through the area. Solano County enjoys a maritime climate due to the close proximity of the Sacramento Delta. Ocean breezes and fog from both Suisun Bay and San Pablo Bay help to cool the vineyards, which extends the growing season and leads to grapes that produce balanced wines with good acidity and phenolic ripeness. Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is ICVGRE. Before fermentation is complete, we halt fermentation by chilling the tank, in order to leave a small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2022 Bacci Rosato
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Our bright and refreshing Bacci Rosato is composed from a blend of grapes we’ve from our estate vineyards along the California coast and Napa Valley. With the coastal influence of the Pacific Ocean and San Pablo Bay keeping temperatures cool, grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop fruit flavors over time while preserving acidity.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. Before fermentation is complete, we halt fermentation by chilling the tank, in order to leave a very small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2022 Dry Riesling
item.description: Vineyard NotesOur 2022 Mt. Veeder Dry Riesling was produced from a single vineyard block located at our estate property Hibbard Ranch. While a section of this estate falls in the Los Carneros designated appellation a small portion of our upper blocks are in the separate sub-appellation of Mt. Veeder which lies above the fog line. The rugged mountain elevations have complex marine Franciscan Formation soils with metamorphosed marine sediments such as Haire loam Cole silt loam Fagan clay loam and Felton gravelly loam with small amounts of more recent Sonoma Volcanic soils. The cool Mt. Veeder appellation overlooking the San Pablo Bay allows the fruit to mature slowly developing incredibly rich concentrated flavors with the extended hang-time of the grapes. Winemaking NotesThe grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is ICVGRE. Before fermentation is complete we halt fermentation by chilling the tank in order to leave a very small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2022 Gamay Rouge
item.description: Vineyard Notes:The Gamay Noir grapes we source for this bright refreshing wine are from our estate vineyard on Solano County. This varietal is most famous for producing the light, effervescent, fruit forward red wines of Beaujolais in eastern France. Characteristically these wines see no barrel aging at all and are enjoyed only weeks after harvest when they are fresh and vibrant. To honor tradition and pay homage to this varietal’s heritage we pick these grapes when they are lower in sugars and higher in acids to preserve the freshness and capture it in bottle to be enjoyed in any season.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is Premier Cuvee. Before fermentation is complete, we halt fermentation by chilling the tank, in order to leave a small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2022 Moscato
item.description: Vineyard Notes:While the translation of this wine from Italian to the English language may be simple, “Muscat Sparkling,” this wine is anything but simplistic. We crafted this sparkling, sweet delight from 75% of our estate grown Muscat while supplementing the remainder of the blend with fruit from one of our beloved growers in Anderson Valley. Fruit from both vineyard locations benefit from a transverse mountain range topography (East to West) with varying soil types, and a collage of microclimates that keep the regions cool. The chill of the fog and breezes from the ocean help extend the growing season, allowing the grapes to fully riper without excessive sugar levels- a key factor behind what makes this wine so elegant and unique. Winemaking Notes: The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50F. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is ICVGRE. Before fermentation is complete, we halt fermentation by chilling the tank, in order to leave a small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2022 Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc
item.description:
Vineyard Notes:Our 2022 Napa Valley Sauvignon Blanc is a refreshing blend that showcases our estate vineyard fruit. A majority (55%) of the blend comes from Carsi Vineyard located in Yountville. It is a 27-acre vineyard named in honor of Vittorio Sattui’s birthplace, the Italian hillside village of Carsi. This appellation is one of the coolest wine growing regions in Napa Valley, which contributes to a long growing season and full-flavored fruit.
The remainder of the blend (45%) is sourced from just down the road at Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This appellation lies on the border of both Napa and Sonoma Counties, but unlike other cool-climate AVAs in Sonoma County, Los Carneros receives much less rainfall, and it is farther from the ocean. The area’s dense, clay soils are not particularly deep or fertile, and these factors when combined produce fruit with concentrated flavors.Winemaking Notes:The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50F. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another vessel where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52F; and the yeast strain is SL3. This is a special yeast strain, ideal for fermentations with varietals that are exceptionally aromatic to preserve these fruit forward characteristics.
A majority of the blend (95%) was fermented in stainless steel tank which preserves the crisp, natural Sauvignon Blanc varietal flavors. A small portion of the blend (2.5%) was fermented in our concrete egg, which creates body and richness on the palate, whilst imparting hints of minerality to the aroma. The remainder of the blend (2.5%) was fermented in French Oak barrels to increase complexity of aromas and flavors. Once fermentation was complete, wines from each vessel were blended, lightly filtered, and bottled just a few months after its harvest to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2022 Off-dry Riesling
item.description: Vineyard NotesFor our 2022 Off-Dry Riesling, we decided that to best capture the essence of California, we would combine the grapes grown from our estate vineyard in Anderson Valley, with fruit from another well-known coastal climate Santa Barbara County. With the coastal influence keeping temperatures cool, grapes are allowed to develop slowly, ripen evenly, and develop their characteristically exotic flavors over time while preserving acidity. Both vineyards are planted utilizing a VSP trellis system, which forces clusters to the outside of the canopy, to increases their exposure to sunlight and enhance the ripening under cool climate conditions.Winemaking NotesThe grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is ICVGRE. Before fermentation is complete, we halt fermentation by chilling the tank, in order to leave a small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: 2022 Tre Uve Bianco
item.description: Vineyard Notes:Tre Uve Bianco (Italian for “three white grapes”) is our newest addition to the V. Sattui family. This delightfully, refreshing white blend is the result of harmonizing three very exciting varietals into one wine: Chenin Blanc, Albariño, and Pinot Grigio. These are the newest grapes to be grown at our estate vineyard Hibbard Ranch in Los Carneros. This renowned growing region’s cool summer nights allow the fruit to retain its acidity while warmer days bring the maturity to perfection. Winemaking Notes: The grapes are harvested at night into ½ ton bins, arriving at the winery early morning and very cold. Whole clusters are pressed, and the juice is transferred to stainless steel tanks, where it settles for 24 hours at 50ºF. Once the gross grape solids (lees) have settled, the clear juice is then racked into another tank where it will undergo fermentation at a very cold temperature, typically 52ºF; and the yeast strain is R2. Before fermentation is complete, we halt fermentation by chilling the tank, in order to leave a small amount of natural grape sugar to balance the acid levels. The finished wine is then lightly filtered and bottled just a few months after its harvest in an effort to capture the freshest, fruitiest aromas and flavors.

item.title: Angelica
item.description: Angelica is a full-bodied and elegant liqueur-like wine. It's sweeter than most ports with a light amber to pale-salmon color and a smooth silky mouthfeel. We arrest the fermentation of the wine at an early stage with the addition of an almost 20-year-old pot-still brandy from Carneros causing the grapes to retain the maximum of their sugar content around 15% residual and an alcohol of about 18%. Store in a cool spot chill in the refrigerator just before opening and serve as an aperitif or dessert wine. After opening it will keep well in the refrigerator for weeks or months.
item.summary: 92.5 POINTS - Ken's Wine Guide

item.title: Madeira
item.description: Winemaking Notes:The solera process is an ingenious system of fractional blending perfected by the Spanish to ensure consistent quality based on the fact that old wines can be refreshed by the addition of a younger wine which then acquires the characteristics of the old wine. We begin with now what is now a 107-year-old vintage port, a lasting vestige from Vittorio Sattui's original winery as the mother (or master-blend). We then fashion primary secondary and tertiary blends "criaderas" using varying ages of Zinfandel - the oldest is more than 35 years old - and add a little back to the mother to keep it alive much like sourdough breadmaking. Over the years our Madeira has won a chest-full of Gold Medals and accolades. A noted wine columnist for the Times and Star in the U.K. Gerald Richardson wrote: “V. Sattui Madeira…is without a doubt the best Madeira in the world…”LEARN MORE ABOUT WHAT MAKES OUR MADEIRA SPECIAL:HOW TO OPEN A BOTTLE OF MADEIRA:STORING MADEIRA: Although our Madeira will age up to several years in perfect cellar conditions after being opened, we recommend it be consumed within 1-3 years after opening. Store it upright in our cupboard like you would a spirit.
item.summary: "BEST MADEIRA IN THE WORLD" - Gerald Richardson, Times and Star, UK
